subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: A stray bullet that injured a Nascar fan in her motor home at Texas Motor Speedway might have been from a rifle of a target shooter, the police said. A 49-year-old man contacted the police after being told of news reports that a woman was hit in the arm Sunday morning by a bullet piercing through the roof of her recreational vehicle camped at the speedway, according to the Fort Worth police. The man told detectives Tuesday that he fired five or six rounds from a single-shot rifle near a rifle range about five miles from the speedway from about 10 a.m. to 11 a.m., the police said. The 62-year-old woman’s condition was unavailable.
